refnamediv.refpurpose: A super easy to use moniker implementation wrapper

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: BonoboMonikerSimple makes writing monikers really extremely easy. To implement a moniker you only have to write 1 function. To register create the moniker object you have to use only 1 call. It can't get much simpler. If you want to use monikers instead of implementing them, you probably want to see bonobo-moniker-util instead.

refsect2.title: BonoboMonikerSimpleResolveFn ()
refsect2.programlisting: Bonobo_Unknown (*BonoboMonikerSimpleResolveFn) (BonoboMoniker *moniker, const Bonobo_ResolveOptions *options, const CORBA_char *requested_interface, CORBA_Environment *ev);
refsect2.para: Type of callback function that implements a simple moniker resolution.

listitem.simpara: CORBA environment, in case an exception needs to be raised
a Bonobo_Unknown as the result of the resolution
the name of the moniker eg. 'file:'
the closure used to resolve the moniker
the constructed moniker or NULL on failure.

refsect2.title: bonobo_moniker_simple_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new instance of a simplified moniker.

listitem.simpara: the display name for the moniker
a resolve function for the moniker

refsect2.title: bonobo_moniker_simple_new_closure ()
refsect2.para: Create a new instance of a simplified moniker.
Instead of the Bonobo_ResolveOptions struct, the closure takes its contents as two arguments: BONOBO_TYPE_RESOLVE_FLAG and G_TYPE_LONG.

listitem.simpara: the display name for the moniker
a closure for the resolve process.
